page.title: 05RECREATION CENTRE
page.content: {Belbroughton Recreation Centre}was built on land purchased by {Public {Subscription }in {1920.}The land was used as a playing field by the cricket and football clubs. Swings for the children were provided by {George Vth {Silver Jubilee }funds. The need for a recreation centre became pressing. Funding came from the {Sports Council, District Council}and {local effort.}The centre was opened in 1980 at a cost of {Â£42,000.}It is run by a committee of local people. The {Parish Council}gives a maintenance grant of{Â£300}per annum for the field and buildings. This is augmented by lettings to the{football club}and the {youth club. } At its opening the centre was described as {"the best thing that has {happened in this village for over a {Century."}
